name: Carter

topics.response_text: {Prison under attack}I don't want to get shot!

topics.topic_text: Show me what you have for sale.
topics.response_text: If I don't have anything you like, well... tough. I don't do special orders.
I was always the guy who could get things, if you know what I mean. Figured I might as well keep on doing it.

topics.topic_text: What did you do to end up here in the first place?
topics.response_text: I worked in a casino in New Reno, and one of the pit bosses decided he didn't like me. Framed me over some caps, and I ended up in here.

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about this place?
topics.response_text: This is where the NCR sent prisoners to "reform" through hard labor. I never saw much reforming around here, myself.
Don't have any other place to go. I'd just end up back in another prison, or dead out in the wasteland.

description:
Carter is a 28 year-old Caucasian Male.

Carter is a weathered-looking man in his late 20s with a scar running down his left cheek. He wears tattered Powder Ganger attire and carries a worn 9mm pistol at his hip. His eyes constantly scan his surroundings, always looking for an opportunity or a threat.

Carter's Personality: Carter is cunning, resourceful, and deeply resentful of the NCR for imprisoning him. He's always looking for ways to profit from situations, whether through legitimate trade or less savory means. Despite his evil karma, he maintains a charismatic facade that makes him surprisingly approachable.

Carter's Backstory: Carter grew up in the shadows of New Reno, working various odd jobs in the casinos until he landed a position as a dealer. When he refused to participate in a rigged game run by a pit boss, he was framed for stealing an undisclosed amount of caps and sentenced to the NCR Correctional Facility. During his incarceration, he cultivated a reputation as someone who could get thingsâ€”whether it was extra rations, contraband, or information. When the Powder Ganger riot took over the facility, Carter saw his opportunity and quickly became one of their most valuable merchants, using his knowledge of the wasteland to broker deals and acquire supplies.
